abstract: Preet Bharara, United States attorney for Southern District of New York, condemns political workings of New York State government, saying total concentration of power among three men--governor, State Assembly speaker and State Senate majority leader--has resulted in gross corruption in Albany; notes corruption case against Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver is only latest example in long line of errant lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, speaking at the New York Law School, took direct aim at how deal-making has long been done in the state capital.
snippet: Preet Bharara, speaking at the New York Law School, took direct aim at how deal-making has long been done in the state capital.

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: U.S. Attorney Criticizes Albany’s ‘Three Men in a Room’ Culture
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Condemns the Culture of Albany
